DataElement.preferredName: Hospitalization Adverse Event Clinical Study Agent Attribution Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an event, entity or condition related to the association with a hospitalization event or presentation of an unfavorable and unintended sign,  symptom, syndrome, or disease to the study agent of a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospitalization Adverse Event Clinical Study Agent Attribution
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the association with a hospitalization event or presentation of an unfavorable and unintended sign,  symptom, syndrome, or disease to the study agent of a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):assigning to a cause or source.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
To assign to a cause or source.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hospitalization Adverse Event Clinical Study Agent Attribution Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied for adverse event related to study medication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Related; connected or associated.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A characteristic used to qualify the adverse event as unlikely related to the medical intervention. According to WHO causality assessment criteria of suspected adverse reactions it is applicable to a clinical event, including laboratory test abnormality, with a temporal relationship to the medical intervention which makes a causal relationship improbable, and in which other interventions or underlying disease provide plausible explanations.

Concepts.longName: Adverse Event Unlikely Related to Intervention
Concepts.definition: A characteristic used to qualify the adverse event as unlikely related to the medical intervention. According to WHO causality assessment criteria of suspected adverse reactions it is applicable to a clinical event, including laboratory test abnormality, with a temporal relationship to the medical intervention which makes a causal relationship improbable, and in which other interventions or underlying disease provide plausible explanations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
